page.title: 06VOLUNTARY MARINE RESERVE
page.content: ON 18TH.,AUGUST, 1985, DR. DAVID BELLAMY OFFICIALLY OPENED THE ST ABBS AND EYEMOUTH VOLUNTARY MARINE NATURE RESERVE. THE AIMS OF THE RESERVE ARE TO CONSERVE THE RICH VARIETY OF PLANT AND ANIMAL LIFE OF THE INSHORE WATERS, AND TO ENCOURAGE THE RESPONSIBLE USE , BOTH RECREATIONALLY AND COMMERCIALLY. THIS SHOULD PROVE MUTUALLY BENEFICIAL TO BOTH THE LOCAL FISHERMEN AND TO THE MANY VISITING DIVERS. THE COAST IS BOTH UNSPOILT AND VARIED WITH A GREAT WEALTH OF ANIMAL AND PLANT LIFE , WHILST THE SEA OFFSHORE IS CLEAN WITH VERY GOOD CLARITY OF WATER CONTRIBUTING TO SOME OF THE BEST SCUBA DIVING IN SCOTLAND IF NOT THE BRITISH ISLES. FOR MANY YEARS THERE HAS BEEN DIFFICULTIES BETWEEN THE FISHERMEN AND THE DIVERS . HOPEFULLY THESE HAVE BEEN RESOLVED AND NOW THE SEA CAN BE FOR EVERYONE.
